message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SY, cs.RO, cs.MA 

The paper deals with a machine learning algorithm (Q-learning) applied to decision-making in a partially observable environment (POMDP). This falls under the category of reinforcement learning, which is a subfield of machine learning. The paper also uses Hidden Markov Models (HMMs) to estimate the POMDP parameters, which is a common technique in the field of probabilistic modeling. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning), followed by cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.SY (Systems and Control). The paper also deals with robotics applications, which could place it under cs.RO (Robotics) and the use of HMMs could also place it under cs.MA (Multi-Agent Systems).
